body_html:
@gngdb you could just copy the function from functional.py and try to use that in Kim's code? Shouldn't require any features that aren't in the current release of PyTorch. It would be good to actually check that it runs as expected (fast is great 😄, but correct is necessary).

Also if you have suggestions for documentation/renaming f and g, that would be useful. Adam Santoro hasn't responded to my tweet 😢

body:
@gngdb you could just copy the function from `functional.py` and try to use that in Kim's code? Shouldn't require any features that aren't in the current release of PyTorch. It would be good to actually check that it runs as expected (fast is great 😄, but correct is necessary).

Also if you have suggestions for documentation/renaming `f` and `g`, that would be useful. Adam Santoro hasn't responded to my tweet :cry:
